00031 #define  OS_VERSION              277u                   /* Version of uC/OS-II (Vx.yy mult. by 100)    */
00032 
00033 #ifdef   OS_GLOBALS
00034 #define  OS_EXT
00035 #else
00036 #define  OS_EXT  extern
00037 #endif
00038 
00039 #ifndef  FALSE
00040 #define  FALSE                     0
00041 #endif
00042 
00043 #ifndef  TRUE
00044 #define  TRUE                      1
00045 #endif
00046 
00047 #define  OS_ASCII_NUL        (char)0
00048 
00049 #define  OS_PRIO_SELF           0xFF                    /* Indicate SELF priority                      */
00050 
00051 #if OS_TASK_STAT_EN > 0
00052 #define  OS_N_SYS_TASKS            2                    /* Number of system tasks                      */
00053 #else
00054 #define  OS_N_SYS_TASKS            1
00055 #endif
00056 
00057 #define  OS_STAT_PRIO       (OS_LOWEST_PRIO - 1)        /* Statistic task priority                     */
00058 #define  OS_IDLE_PRIO       (OS_LOWEST_PRIO)            /* IDLE      task priority                     */
00059 
00060 #define  OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE ((OS_LOWEST_PRIO) / 8 + 1)   /* Size of event table                         */
00061 #define  OS_RDY_TBL_SIZE   ((OS_LOWEST_PRIO) / 8 + 1)   /* Size of ready table                         */
00062 
00063 #define  OS_TASK_IDLE_ID       65535u                   /* I.D. numbers for Idle and Stat tasks        */
00064 #define  OS_TASK_STAT_ID       65534u
00065 
00066 #define  OS_EVENT_EN       (((OS_Q_EN > 0) && (OS_MAX_QS > 0)) || (OS_MBOX_EN > 0) || (OS_SEM_EN > 0) || (OS_MUTEX_EN > 0))

00069 /*
00070 *********************************************************************************************************
00071 *                              TASK STATUS (Bit definition for OSTCBStat)
00072 *********************************************************************************************************
00073 */
00074 #define  OS_STAT_RDY            0x00        /* Ready to run                                            */
00075 #define  OS_STAT_SEM            0x01        /* Pending on semaphore                                    */
00076 #define  OS_STAT_MBOX           0x02        /* Pending on mailbox                                      */
00077 #define  OS_STAT_Q              0x04        /* Pending on queue                                        */
00078 #define  OS_STAT_SUSPEND        0x08        /* Task is suspended                                       */
00079 #define  OS_STAT_MUTEX          0x10        /* Pending on mutual exclusion semaphore                   */
00080 #define  OS_STAT_FLAG           0x20        /* Pending on event flag group                             */
00081 
00082 #define  OS_STAT_PEND_ANY      (OS_STAT_SEM | OS_STAT_MBOX | OS_STAT_Q | OS_STAT_MUTEX | OS_STAT_FLAG)
00083 
00084 /*
00085 *********************************************************************************************************
00086 *                                        OS_EVENT types
00087 *********************************************************************************************************
00088 */
00089 #define  OS_EVENT_TYPE_UNUSED      0
00090 #define  OS_EVENT_TYPE_MBOX        1
00091 #define  OS_EVENT_TYPE_Q           2
00092 #define  OS_EVENT_TYPE_SEM         3
00093 #define  OS_EVENT_TYPE_MUTEX       4
00094 #define  OS_EVENT_TYPE_FLAG        5
00095 
00096 /*
00097 *********************************************************************************************************
00098 *                                         EVENT FLAGS
00099 *********************************************************************************************************
00100 */
00101 #define  OS_FLAG_WAIT_CLR_ALL      0        /* Wait for ALL    the bits specified to be CLR (i.e. 0)   */ 
00102 #define  OS_FLAG_WAIT_CLR_AND      0
00103 
00104 #define  OS_FLAG_WAIT_CLR_ANY      1        /* Wait for ANY of the bits specified to be CLR (i.e. 0)   */
00105 #define  OS_FLAG_WAIT_CLR_OR       1
00106 
00107 #define  OS_FLAG_WAIT_SET_ALL      2        /* Wait for ALL    the bits specified to be SET (i.e. 1)   */ 
00108 #define  OS_FLAG_WAIT_SET_AND      2
00109 
00110 #define  OS_FLAG_WAIT_SET_ANY      3        /* Wait for ANY of the bits specified to be SET (i.e. 1)   */
00111 #define  OS_FLAG_WAIT_SET_OR       3
00112 
00113 
00114 #define  OS_FLAG_CONSUME        0x80        /* Consume the flags if condition(s) satisfied             */
00115 
00116 
00117 #define  OS_FLAG_CLR               0
00118 #define  OS_FLAG_SET               1
00119 
00120 /*
00121 *********************************************************************************************************
00122 *                                   Values for OSTickStepState
00123 *
00124 * Note(s): This feature is used by uC/OS-View.
00125 *********************************************************************************************************
00126 */
00127 
00128 #if OS_TICK_STEP_EN > 0
00129 #define  OS_TICK_STEP_DIS          0        /* Stepping is disabled, tick runs as mormal               */
00130 #define  OS_TICK_STEP_WAIT         1        /* Waiting for uC/OS-View to set OSTickStepState to _ONCE  */
00131 #define  OS_TICK_STEP_ONCE         2        /* Process tick once and wait for next cmd from uC/OS-View */
00132 #endif
00133 
00134 /*
00135 *********************************************************************************************************
00136 *       Possible values for 'opt' argument of OSSemDel(), OSMboxDel(), OSQDel() and OSMutexDel()
00137 *********************************************************************************************************
00138 */
00139 #define  OS_DEL_NO_PEND            0
00140 #define  OS_DEL_ALWAYS             1
00141 
00142 /*
00143 *********************************************************************************************************
00144 *                                     OS???PostOpt() OPTIONS
00145 *
00146 * These #defines are used to establish the options for OSMboxPostOpt() and OSQPostOpt().
00147 *********************************************************************************************************
00148 */
00149 #define  OS_POST_OPT_NONE       0x00        /* Post to highest priority task waiting                   */
00150 #define  OS_POST_OPT_BROADCAST  0x01        /* Broadcast message to ALL tasks waiting                  */  
00151 #define  OS_POST_OPT_FRONT      0x02        /* Post to highest priority task waiting                   */
00152 
00153 /*
00154 *********************************************************************************************************
00155 *                                 TASK OPTIONS (see OSTaskCreateExt()) 
00156 *********************************************************************************************************
00157 */
00158 #define  OS_TASK_OPT_STK_CHK  0x0001        /* Enable stack checking for the task                      */
00159 #define  OS_TASK_OPT_STK_CLR  0x0002        /* Clear the stack when the task is create                 */
00160 #define  OS_TASK_OPT_SAVE_FP  0x0004        /* Save the contents of any floating-point registers       */
00161

00250 #if OS_EVENT_EN && (OS_MAX_EVENTS > 0)
00251 typedef struct os_event {
00252     INT8U    OSEventType;                    /* Type of event control block (see OS_EVENT_TYPE_???)     */
00253     INT8U    OSEventGrp;                     /* Group corresponding to tasks waiting for event to occur */
00254     INT16U   OSEventCnt;                     /* Semaphore Count (not used if other EVENT type)          */
00255     void    *OSEventPtr;                     /* Pointer to message or queue structure                   */
00256     INT8U    OSEventTbl[OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE];  /* List of tasks waiting for event to occur                */
00257 #if OS_EVENT_NAME_SIZE > 1
00258     char     OSEventName[OS_EVENT_NAME_SIZE];
00259 #endif
00260 } OS_EVENT;
00261 #endif
00262 
00263 
00264 /*
00265 *********************************************************************************************************
00266 *                                       EVENT FLAGS CONTROL BLOCK
00267 *********************************************************************************************************
00268 */
00269 
00270 #if (OS_VERSION >= 251) && (OS_FLAG_EN > 0) && (OS_MAX_FLAGS > 0)
00271 typedef struct os_flag_grp {                /* Event Flag Group                                        */
00272     INT8U         OSFlagType;               /* Should be set to OS_EVENT_TYPE_FLAG                     */
00273     void         *OSFlagWaitList;           /* Pointer to first NODE of task waiting on event flag     */
00274     OS_FLAGS      OSFlagFlags;              /* 8, 16 or 32 bit flags                                   */
00275 #if OS_FLAG_NAME_SIZE > 1
00276     char          OSFlagName[OS_FLAG_NAME_SIZE];
00277 #endif
00278 } OS_FLAG_GRP;    
00279 
00280     
00281     
00282 typedef struct os_flag_node {               /* Event Flag Wait List Node                               */
00283     void         *OSFlagNodeNext;           /* Pointer to next     NODE in wait list                   */
00284     void         *OSFlagNodePrev;           /* Pointer to previous NODE in wait list                   */
00285     void         *OSFlagNodeTCB;            /* Pointer to TCB of waiting task                          */  
00286     void         *OSFlagNodeFlagGrp;        /* Pointer to Event Flag Group                             */  
00287     OS_FLAGS      OSFlagNodeFlags;          /* Event flag to wait on                                   */  
00288     INT8U         OSFlagNodeWaitType;       /* Type of wait:                                           */
00289                                             /*      OS_FLAG_WAIT_AND                                   */
00290                                             /*      OS_FLAG_WAIT_ALL                                   */
00291                                             /*      OS_FLAG_WAIT_OR                                    */
00292                                             /*      OS_FLAG_WAIT_ANY                                   */
00293 } OS_FLAG_NODE;
00294 #endif

00304 typedef struct os_mbox_data {

00311 /*
00312 *********************************************************************************************************
00313 *                                     MEMORY PARTITION DATA STRUCTURES
00314 *********************************************************************************************************
00315 */
00316 
00317 #if (OS_MEM_EN > 0) && (OS_MAX_MEM_PART > 0)
00318 typedef struct os_mem {                   /* MEMORY CONTROL BLOCK                                      */
00319     void   *OSMemAddr;                    /* Pointer to beginning of memory partition                  */
00320     void   *OSMemFreeList;                /* Pointer to list of free memory blocks                     */
00321     INT32U  OSMemBlkSize;                 /* Size (in bytes) of each block of memory                   */
00322     INT32U  OSMemNBlks;                   /* Total number of blocks in this partition                  */
00323     INT32U  OSMemNFree;                   /* Number of memory blocks remaining in this partition       */
00324 #if OS_MEM_NAME_SIZE > 1
00325     char    OSMemName[OS_MEM_NAME_SIZE];  /* Memory partition name                                     */
00326 #endif
00327 } OS_MEM;
00328 
00329 
00330 typedef struct os_mem_data {
00331     void   *OSAddr;                    /* Pointer to the beginning address of the memory partition     */
00332     void   *OSFreeList;                /* Pointer to the beginning of the free list of memory blocks   */
00333     INT32U  OSBlkSize;                 /* Size (in bytes) of each memory block                         */
00334     INT32U  OSNBlks;                   /* Total number of blocks in the partition                      */
00335     INT32U  OSNFree;                   /* Number of memory blocks free                                 */
00336     INT32U  OSNUsed;                   /* Number of memory blocks used                                 */
00337 } OS_MEM_DATA;
00338 #endif

00346 
00347 #if OS_MUTEX_EN > 0
00348 typedef struct os_mutex_data {
00349     INT8U   OSEventTbl[OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE];  /* List of tasks waiting for event to occur                */
00350     INT8U   OSEventGrp;                     /* Group corresponding to tasks waiting for event to occur */
00351     INT8U   OSValue;                        /* Mutex value (0 = used, 1 = available)                   */
00352     INT8U   OSOwnerPrio;                    /* Mutex owner's task priority or 0xFF if no owner         */
00353     INT8U   OSMutexPIP;                     /* Priority Inheritance Priority or 0xFF if no owner       */
00354 } OS_MUTEX_DATA;
00355 #endif

00360 *********************************************************************************************************

00362 
00363 #if OS_Q_EN > 0
00364 typedef struct os_q {                   /* QUEUE CONTROL BLOCK                                         */
00365     struct os_q   *OSQPtr;              /* Link to next queue control block in list of free blocks     */
00366     void         **OSQStart;            /* Pointer to start of queue data                              */
00367     void         **OSQEnd;              /* Pointer to end   of queue data                              */
00368     void         **OSQIn;               /* Pointer to where next message will be inserted  in   the Q  */
00369     void         **OSQOut;              /* Pointer to where next message will be extracted from the Q  */
00370     INT16U         OSQSize;             /* Size of queue (maximum number of entries)                   */
00371     INT16U         OSQEntries;          /* Current number of entries in the queue                      */
00372 } OS_Q;
00373 
00374 
00375 typedef struct os_q_data {
00376     void          *OSMsg;               /* Pointer to next message to be extracted from queue          */
00377     INT16U         OSNMsgs;             /* Number of messages in message queue                         */
00378     INT16U         OSQSize;             /* Size of message queue                                       */
00379     INT8U          OSEventTbl[OS_EVENT_TBL_SIZE];  /* List of tasks waiting for event to occur         */
00380     INT8U          OSEventGrp;          /* Group corresponding to tasks waiting for event to occur     */
00381 } OS_Q_DATA;
00382 #endif

00412 /*
00413 *********************************************************************************************************
00414 *                                          TASK CONTROL BLOCK
00415 *********************************************************************************************************
00416 */
00417 
00418 typedef struct os_tcb {
00419     OS_STK          *OSTCBStkPtr;      /* Pointer to current top of stack                              */
00420 
00421 #if OS_TASK_CREATE_EXT_EN > 0
00422     void            *OSTCBExtPtr;      /* Pointer to user definable data for TCB extension             */
00423     OS_STK          *OSTCBStkBottom;   /* Pointer to bottom of stack                                   */
00424     INT32U           OSTCBStkSize;     /* Size of task stack (in number of stack elements)             */
00425     INT16U           OSTCBOpt;         /* Task options as passed by OSTaskCreateExt()                  */
00426     INT16U           OSTCBId;          /* Task ID (0..65535)                                           */
00427 #endif
00428 
00429     struct os_tcb   *OSTCBNext;        /* Pointer to next     TCB in the TCB list                      */
00430     struct os_tcb   *OSTCBPrev;        /* Pointer to previous TCB in the TCB list                      */
00431 
00432 #if OS_EVENT_EN
00433     OS_EVENT        *OSTCBEventPtr;    /* Pointer to event control block                               */
00434 #endif
00435 
00436 #if ((OS_Q_EN > 0) && (OS_MAX_QS > 0)) || (OS_MBOX_EN > 0)
00437     void            *OSTCBMsg;         /* Message received from OSMboxPost() or OSQPost()              */
00438 #endif
00439 
00440 #if (OS_VERSION >= 251) && (OS_FLAG_EN > 0) && (OS_MAX_FLAGS > 0)
00441 #if OS_TASK_DEL_EN > 0
00442     OS_FLAG_NODE    *OSTCBFlagNode;    /* Pointer to event flag node                                   */
00443 #endif    
00444     OS_FLAGS         OSTCBFlagsRdy;    /* Event flags that made task ready to run                      */
00445 #endif
00446 
00447     INT16U           OSTCBDly;         /* Nbr ticks to delay task or, timeout waiting for event        */
00448     INT8U            OSTCBStat;        /* Task status                                                  */
00449     BOOLEAN          OSTCBPendTO;      /* Flag indicating PEND timed out (TRUE == timed out)           */
00450     INT8U            OSTCBPrio;        /* Task priority (0 == highest, 63 == lowest)                   */
00451 
00452     INT8U            OSTCBX;           /* Bit position in group  corresponding to task priority (0..7) */
00453     INT8U            OSTCBY;           /* Index into ready table corresponding to task priority        */
00454     INT8U            OSTCBBitX;        /* Bit mask to access bit position in ready table               */
00455     INT8U            OSTCBBitY;        /* Bit mask to access bit position in ready group               */
00456 
00457 #if OS_TASK_DEL_EN > 0
00458     INT8U            OSTCBDelReq;      /* Indicates whether a task needs to delete itself              */
00459 #endif
00460 
00461 #if OS_TASK_PROFILE_EN > 0
00462     INT32U           OSTCBCtxSwCtr;    /* Number of time the task was switched in                      */
00463     INT32U           OSTCBCyclesTot;   /* Total number of clock cycles the task has been running       */
00464     INT32U           OSTCBCyclesStart; /* Snapshot of cycle counter at start of task resumption        */
00465     OS_STK          *OSTCBStkBase;     /* Pointer to the beginning of the task stack                   */
00466     INT32U           OSTCBStkUsed;     /* Number of bytes used from the stack                          */
00467 #endif
00468 
00469 #if OS_TASK_NAME_SIZE > 1
00470     char             OSTCBTaskName[OS_TASK_NAME_SIZE];
00471 #endif
00472 } OS_TCB;

00523 OS_EXT  OS_TCB           *OSTCBList;                       /* Pointer to doubly linked list of TCBs    */

00531 #if (OS_MEM_EN > 0) && (OS_MAX_MEM_PART > 0)
00532 OS_EXT  OS_MEM           *OSMemFreeList;            /* Pointer to free list of memory partitions       */
00533 OS_EXT  OS_MEM            OSMemTbl[OS_MAX_MEM_PART];/* Storage for memory partition manager            */
00534 #endif
00535 
00536 #if (OS_Q_EN > 0) && (OS_MAX_QS > 0)
00537 OS_EXT  OS_Q             *OSQFreeList;              /* Pointer to list of free QUEUE control blocks    */
00538 OS_EXT  OS_Q              OSQTbl[OS_MAX_QS];        /* Table of QUEUE control blocks                   */
00539 #endif
00540 
00541 #if OS_TIME_GET_SET_EN > 0   
00542 OS_EXT  volatile  INT32U  OSTime;                   /* Current value of system time (in ticks)         */
00543 #endif
00544 
00545 
00546 extern  INT8U   const     OSMapTbl[8];              /* Priority->Bit Mask lookup table                 */
00547 extern  INT8U   const     OSUnMapTbl[256];          /* Priority->Index    lookup table                 */
00548

00974 * compile time error.
